values:
So I haven't written anything in a while.    Partly as I haven't had much to write..my life being the usual combination of work and goofing off when I get home.    Weird and interesting experiences have just not been happening enough to be worth noting.  
 I have however started an old hobby which I have not done for some years.. LARPing.   It is partly due to the lack of table top in my life..Ronin is running a really good oriental adventures game, but other than that I've had nothing.. and with greyhawk going out and no 4.0 D&D RPGA to replace it.. I'm kind of stuck till the fall if I want organized D&D.  Also since I felt the need to shake up my routine and meet people outside my current social circle.   I used to play in at least three LARPs but kind of fell out of the habit when the local larp scene (or at least the games I was in) collapsed.  But I must say that I am enjoying it, since LARP tends to feature character and plot more sharply than table top which easily devolves into find them and kill their stuff.   A lot of my table top friends find it kind of silly, but I don't care.  Yes we are a bunch of adults who are essentially playing pretend, but you know what, I'm good with that and I enjoy it.. It's no harder than any other role-playing game to explain to the uninitiated.

It has been winter since December and the weather has been crap on and off since November this year, and one of the worst winters in years.   Which is why I was completely baffled today when me and Ronin got off the bus and watched a man in an SUV swerving around the corner onto Waterloo almost driving sideways at one point and then headed down the street at a speed unsafe for optimal weather conditions.. and not the few inches of snow that had already fallen and were still fallen.     At this point you can't really blame ignorance about driving conditions for behaviour like that, I mean we've had months to get used to them.   My only explanation is that this driver is so sick of winter that he wants to commit vehicular suicide.  I just hope he didn't hit any innocent bystanders.

Ronin:   so you reading about the gary gaygax assisination?
Nirai:   What?
Ronin:   Yeah, Steve Jackson had him klled.
Nirai:   You have way too much spare time.

It's march already.    While it doesn't feel like spring outside, it means officially it will be spring soon, and that means that at most there is only a month and a half of the really rotten weather to deal with.  While it was nice to have snow at winter time again, I'm tired of winter.   I want to enjoy being outside again, not have to deal with cold or snow blowing in my face.   I'm tired of taking pictures of snow drifts, they all start to look the same after a while and it might be nice to take pictures of green things instead, or maybe even flowers.   I'm getting cabin fever from being stuck inside the apartment all weekend mostly because going outside is a pain or the weather is nasty, and even when it's sunny out, it's way to cold and bright.    I know its still more than a month away, but I am really looking forward to spring.

So sometime last night our monitor died...the white screen of death.  It didn't recover overnight so Ronin figures the monitor is probably cooked.   Luckily we have an old monitor from one of our older computers, and it works.   Using the internet feels a little bit like I am now viewing the world through a small port hole on the side of a ship which keeps fogging up, but it's better than the Wii browser, which I find way too fiddly.   
 It was comforting to realize however that thanks to the Wii that if our computer were to fail, the money we pay for an internet connection would still be worth it, and I would not be completely cut off from the internet at home.    It might happen.   Our computer is cobbled together from bits and those bits are old.  I guess we will need to add new computer to the list of stuff we need to get at some point in the near future.

I'm in a fairly dark mood today.   A combination of things, things that are breaking down, things which are lacking, and once I start down that way I just keep thinking of things that annoy me, or terrible horrible things that could happen, and then everything I come across annoys me.    Some guy at the bus station in Kitchener muttered something while I passed him, and sort of looked at me when I sat down.  I think  he was one of the crazies, but I was in such a bad mood that I just sat there, ignored him and read my book in angry glaring silence.   Shortly afterwards he got up and left the bus station.  I think I might have scared him off. 
 I usually take my mp3 player off before I get off the greyhound, but today I wore it all the way home, partly to block out the noise of annoying people around me, and partly so I would have something to think about rather than letting my thoughts wander. 
 When I got home, I made myself a bagel with peanut butter and started looking through moosewood cookbooks for something to make for lunch next week.   I have decided to make Menestra because I have been craving articoke hearts, and I used to make it all the time when I first left home.   Some how thinking about food and eating some made me feel a little better.

5 things I want to do more of in 2008:

I don't do New Years Resolutions.   Usually whatever I decide I'm going to differently I end up giving up by mid-February anyway.   If you are going to do a thing, do it, and don't wait for a special time of year and the same goes for stopping doing something.   However in the spirit of new beginnings and all that, here is a list of things I want to do more in the coming year,  some of which I actually started doing a little sooner than January, some of which are an on-going struggle.   I'm trying to make it a list of positive things rather than I won't do that anymore. 

1/ Get more exercise (swim, walk, play the Wii, or there wise use my muscles and increase my heart rate.) I want to feel more healthy and in shape. 

2/ Eat more things that are good for me (vegetables, fruit, whole grains, home-made). 

3/ Do more creative things (knitting, embroidery, writing, taking pictures, cooking)

4/ Learn new things (learn Japanese, learn to crochet, making pastry)

5/  Relax (have more hot baths, take more time for myself, stress less about things).

I think the weather is teasing me.   This year especially I have not been looking forward to winter and having steeled myself for weeks of cold and blowing snow... suddenly it's beautiful and mild outside.   The kind of weather I really like, wet, and mild, with the air feeling damp and smelling like fresh earth.  So very spring like... but I know this is just a preview, and it will be cold and miserable in a few days. 

Yeah, I'm talking about the weather again.   Why is it so easy?   I mean what is the topic you are most likely to discuss with strangers.. the weather.    It might be a Canadian thing, since we have a lot of it, but I think unless you live in a place where the weather barely changes, it tends to be the most popular topic of small talk.  

 I guess it is one of those few universal things.   Everyone is effected by the weather and if you are close enough to make small talk, you are being effected by the same weather and when you find yourself caught in a small space like an elevator with a stranger, assuming you don't want to stand in sullen silence, a nice conversation about the weather, how hot it is, or how cold, and how long it will stay this way, is a nice ice breaker that will carry you through till you get to your floor.     Everyone has an opinion of the weather but most people don't care if you express a different opinion.  It's not controversial.  It's not like it will change anything and it gives you something to talk more about.. why you think that.   And if you agree, you can even get a bit more friendly and reminisce, or maybe look for sympathy or give it, or even make a joke.  Nothing which ever gets too personal but still a bit of human contact, so the next time you see that person you might smile or nod.    Feel like you know your neighbours a bit more.

I've heard we are due to get some heavy snow (15 cm or more) and for once, I don't care.   I'm home, and we are settled in for a night of feasting, to be followed by a day of relaxing.   New Years is one of the most laid back holidays of the year.   If you are going to party, you do it on the night before and since all the stores are closed, the day is pretty much free for doing nothing but spending time with family/friends and playing with all your new Christmas stuff.   All the pressure and craziness has been drained out of the holiday. 

Looking back on 2007, it seems like it went by way too fast. 

It was the year I discovered video games.   I got my DS in 2006 but this year, I went from having two or three games to having fifteen or sixteen.   We also got a Wii and there are a bunch of games I love on that too, though really the DS is my system.    

This was also the year that me and RwR got Internet for home after a good number of years without.  I think the Wii was a contributing factor in that... but it is nice to have for other reasons too. 

Downtown Guelph took a pretty big hit with the Gummer building fire, and a few places I really like (like Gemini Jetpack) closed... but I have found some new places (like the RedBrick Cafe)

There was some major upheaval at work, including three large moves and a few months of practically working out of boxes.   But I think my current workspace is better than the old one, so I guess it was worth it. 

All in all, it's been a pretty good year.     At least all the people I care about appear to have made it through intact (and four people I know successfully added to that group by having babies), and that's pretty good in my eyes.

So another Christmas is past.. fading into memories and the Christmas haul slowly integrates itself into my collection of stuff.    

Some highlights: 

Christmas 1#   :   Santa brought me a digital camera.   I have already taken at least 182 pictures, at least according to the jpg numbers.   I have also created a flickr account, so if you are into flickr please look me up and add me as a contact (same name as here, but two words, no underscore).    I also got My Sims and Honeycomb Beat, two games I really wanted, a pokedex which I didn't know how much I needed (it has where to catch and evolve all diamond pokemon, plus a guide to post game stuff, assuming I ever finish this game) an emerald, a cute dragon tee-shirt (Ronin thought I needed more girly stuff) and a teach your self Japanese cd package, plus some nifty red earrings and red stripy knee socks that actually fit without cutting off my circulation. 

Christmas 2#:   A micro sd card so I can boost my mp3 player, an leather sd card holder which makes a very snazzy ds game case, some cool/cute pens, some very nice pottery, some very modern glass pendents, a Japanese print calendar, a cook book I have wanted for a long time, some cds (Johnny Cash, Gypsy dance music, and Iranian music) and books, some cute cat slipper socks, and some nifty place-mats and some sushi rollers. 

Christmas 3#:   Sim City and Puzzle Quest, a bunch of books including a scholarly look rpgs and computer games, a cape, leg warmers (black and red stripes), some books on wine, including one on Ontario wines, and a bottle of wine. 

Not bad.  
There was also a very nice meal of turkey and the next day roast lamb, along with all the Christmas traditions (mulled apple cider, coconut squares, and of course candy). 
 Me and Ronin stayed overnight at my Mom's and the next morning, thanks to the fog, everything was coated in hoarfrost.   It was so beautiful.    It was foggy as soon as we got outside Kitchener and headed to Stratford, but all the trees were coated in white frost.    The roads however, despite the fog were very clear and the car held together.       So this year was a pretty good Christmas.

My day kind of exploded around 3:00pm.   My phone that had maybe rung two or three times in the past week, suddenly wouldn't stop ringing and I would be in the middle of a conversation with someone and the message light would start blinking.   If I left my desk to send a fax or get something I printed, I would return to find the message light blinking.   It didn't really let up and when the end of the day came, I kind of abandoned my desk rather than concluding anything.  
Since I was running late, I found my self scrambling to catch the bus, which meant hurrying as fast as I could on icy surfaces.   All the sunshine had melted the slush from this morning but it had all gotten or was quickly getting slick again.   
  So it wasn't until I was almost at the bus stop when I looked up to see the sky.

      The sky was the dusky purple colour with bright pink clouds, in wooly tufts, outlined by purple and back.   They glowed brighter than the rest of the sky and it was the kind of thing that made me wish I had a camera (though I would never be able to capture the perfect quality of the light) or even better, the ability to capture the scene in paint.   Watching the clouds slowly drift across the darkening sky, I thought of other clouds I'd glimpsed and the Northren lights  It struck me then, while cars sped past me, and while we are locked in the craziness of modern life, chasing whatever we think is so important, the sky is removed from all of that, a shining beautiful thing that slowly flows, radiant perfect beauty which is undisturbed by the world below.      Constantly changing yet somehow eternal.

For all those people who laughed when Snake managed to fool all those guards with his cardboard box in Metal Gear Solid, I give you this Proof that cardboard has an application in modern stealth technology.

So, I haven't posted in a long while... and wanted to assure everyone I am not dead or anything.  My life has been either busy, or I have been too tired recovering from the busyness to post.  Lets see, there was my vacation, work has been insane after that, and weekends have been mostly occupied by the Toronto International Film Festival, which was exhausting and expensive, but I did have fun and see some movies which ranged from great to unique. 

Anyway, I hope to post more in the coming weeks, but I can make no promises.   This is really the first weekend in a while that I haven't had a full schedule and we are still somewhat busy with RwR's Eberron game, and people coming in from out of town for that, but at least sunday will be the first day in a while where we can relax.

Being home for a large part of the day for three days straight, I find myself checking my favourite haunts in the electronic world every couple of hours in the desperate search for boredom easing content.  Since it was monday and doesn't appear to be a holiday to our southern neighbours, I wasn't completely disappointed (Penny Arcade and Order of the Stick both updated) though livejournal has been quiet.   
That and I have the disadvantage of being one of those rare people amongst my friends who actually likes getting e-mail and when given the opportunity will check my e-mail as often as possible.  
 RwR has kept himself occupied by playing his latest game, a gundam rpg game which is as pretty as a game about giant fighting robots can be and has a soundtrack which sounds as close to final fantasy VII as possible without being a copyright violation. 
 While he has been doing that I have completed a toon-doku puzzle, fished for an hour on animal crossing (and caught a really rare fish), read from my two books, finished reading Bust (it was half done) and checked my e-mail and favourite websites at least ten times.    And now I need to find something else to do.

It's already the second last long weekend of the summer.  Yikes.   Of course when you don't have the entire summer off anymore it doesn't really feel like summer has started except for the heat and all the kids running around during the day.   
 I took Friday off, but I didn't get anything done that I planned to do except laundry because it was so hot, and well SandraRegina came over for a swim and then we went to the mall which has air conditioning.    Somehow we managed to spend four hours there without really noticing.... I guess my mallrat is showing.    But funnily enough when we finally emerged from the mall, the weather had improved and it was cooler.   

On Saturday I painted my toenails, which is something I've been planning on doing since...uh April when I bought the polish.    I don't do girly stuff like that very often.   Nail polish and lipstick are really the only cosmetics beside perfume I have any time for.   And I don't wear either very often.   

Today RwR took the fam. out to see the Simpsons which was pretty good.   It was pretty much an extended episode made for a more liberal channel (like showcase or some other non-network pay t.v channel.    But it was an extended episode from a mid season simpsons (like 5 or 6) which made it better than your average movie.   I don't know if I would call it great cinema but it was fun, and the Simpsons is one of those things that is a bonding kind of thing for RwR, me and his creatures.  (though I'm sure we would all be first in line if they ever made a Futurama movie.   
 And I have one more day to goof off before I have to go back to work.

Because I had SandraRegina drop me at the mall to hunt for b-day gifts for the Ronin, I didn't end up getting home until 8/8:30.    It made for a rather long day, and for reasons I don't really feel like getting into right now, the end was somewhat stressful.   Nothing dire yet.    So I'm feeling pretty tired, especially because the last couple hours before I got home were spent on my feet and a good forty-five minutes of that was in a mall, which is always a somewhat exhausting proposition.   

I then took the bus downtown and spent some quality time browsing at the Bookshelf.  That took energy but was much more pleasant than the mall which seemed to have populated itself with pre-teens who look a lot younger than I seem to remember them being who were trying unsuccessfully to convince the world that they were the jaded and sullen teens who also sulked the mall.    

Because I perpetually under-estimate my finances, I found myself able to indulge myself in a coffee and a brownie at the Red Brick Cafe.    It's nice to know that when you are feeling a little broke and a bit put upon by the universe that there are still places you can go and drink coffee, perhaps nibble on some baked treat and read to the tones of really good 1950's jazz and listen to the the counter staff chat about recipes they are trying out.    

When I lived in Toronto I assumed that places like this are fairly easy to find and it wasn't until I moved to Guelph which for most of the time I lived there had a really good coffee shop that closed at six.. great for a day off, not so good for the end of a long day.    Needless to say, I am grateful that such a place has finally come to Guelph.   It is the sort of place that Hemingway was writing about in A Clean Well-Lighted Place, a place where you can go even late at night, and find some comfort.     In most restaurants I feel awkward ordering by myself and sitting at a table eating.   To find somewhere that I can do this and read or even write undisturbed in public is very valuable, because the company of counter staff and other patrons equally immersed in their own pursuits is comforting and makes you feel like you are part of something, a scene or a community.   

Sorry for the commercial but I think places like this need to be celebrated every now than then.

Your Score: Androgynous

You scored 56 masculinity and 63 femininity!

You scored high on both masculinity and femininity. You have a strong personality exhibiting characteristics of both traditional sex roles.

Link: The Bem Sex Role Inventory Test written by weirdscience on OkCupid Free Online Dating, home of the The Dating Persona Test
I must be feeling "girly" today.

One more reason for me to love the Sci-Fi Channel, they are doing a t.v. version of Neal Stephenson's Diamond Age (one of my favourite books ever).   Ordinarily I'd be worried but these are the people who brought us the Dune miniseries, and Battlestar, so I think, it might be really good.   http://www.sffworld.com/news/358.html


In other news, they are also making a sequel to Alien vs. Predator (with the imaginative title of Aliens vs. Predators)  but maybe this one will be good.   I really don't care.   I will probably go and see any movie that features the Predator, especially if they are fighting Aliens because they will be the good guys and I will feel less creepy about cheering for them. 

And they are also making a sequel to Bubba Ho-Tep, with vampires... called Bubba-Nosferatu.   
and a bunch of other stuff according to SFFworld.com.  http://www.sffworld.com/news/361.html

I want Pokemon Diamond so bad I can taste it.   I am practically reconfiguring my finances so I can get this game.   It's sad really.   And ironically enough, I won't really have time to play it after today, as I am back at work and I have a large number of other games and things to do after work...but for some reason, the desire for this game keeps growing in my mind (probably due to the fact that Battle Revolution is coming out and Rats has Pokemon Pearl..) despite the fact that there are other games I lust after (Sim City, Puzzle Quest, and so on).   But I have put myself in the way of way too much Nintendo propaganda of late.     And while I've never actually played a pokemon game, (exception Trozei and a little bit of pokemon red) I've always been something of fan of the cartoon and related pokemon stuff.   But really, you couldn't get a game (except maybe Animal Crossing) which is more tailored for all my gaming preferences: 1/ really cute, 2/ collecting stuff, 3/ customizable,  4/ easy game play (RPG) with no manual dexterity required, and now 5/ available on my favourite system (DS) with connections to my second favourite system (Wii).     And all the excuses I have (Rats will be jealous if I get it first (she bought it for herself a month ago)...I don't have the money (but breakfast didn't cost as much as I thought it would and with my left over money when OSAP goes out....I might be able to...urgh. my excuses are going away fast.    I'm a grown woman.  I shouldn't be getting this excited over a game.   I should be paying off my mastercard or buying presents for RwR birthday so I'm not broke on our vacation.....     Right now my resolve is holding, but we'll see for how long.

I'm feeling kind of listless today.   Yesterday RwR ran his Eberron game, which was a lot of fun.    Then we stayed up late playing Wii sports (okay, so RwR and the Bad Parrot and friend did the playing.  But it was still fun to watch.   
  Today, we went out for breakfast and then spent the rest of the day lounging.   Which is nice, but it's too cold to go swimming and I'm in one of those easily bored moods... so I keep flipping back and forth between books, the computer and my ds.   The creatures are occupying themselves with Wii sports, so at least they are getting some exercise, but part of me wishes it was nicer out so we could go swimming or go to the park.     I'm not really a crowd person, so we haven't even entertained the thought of going to one of the Canada's 140th birthday parties.    But we will probably get to watch fireworks off the balcony tonight if it doesn't rain.    And me and RwR get the day off tomorrow, which means at least one more day to sleep in and maybe the weather will be a little warmer.

My day started quite nicely, with a breakfast at Angel's from RwR, and then I walked him to his bus and went home.     After which I suddenly found it very hard to motivate myself to do anything.   I ended up sitting on the couch and reading, but I had an overwhelming urge to crawl back into bed and stay there.  It wasn't that I was feeling sick, more a huge sense of malaise came over me.    

I literarly had to force myself to shower, get dressed again and go out the door for my dr.'s appointment (just a routine check, bone density,some jargle my doctor wants to keep tabs on that I don't feel like getting into).  This in and of it's self wasn't really the source of my feeling.   I've had this sort of appointment before and it's non-painful and non-intrusive.   But I just felt very negative about the idea of doing anything this morning.   It was literaly one of those days I had to force myself to go out and have a good time.   Every thing went smoothly.   I think the human interaction actually made me feel better about things. 

So I went to the Red Brick and got myself a coffee and a crossant which looked too good to pass up.   There is a benefit from going to the Red Brick earlier in the day, something I learned last time my Dad was in town.... they have all manner of good stuff that dosen't make it to seven, which is when I generally darken their doors.    So having had coffee and a crossant and a good read, I was in a much better mood when I went home, though except for some laundry and dishes, I really didn't accomplish much, but at least I was lazy in a relaxed, contented way.

I am feeling better right now, but having spent most of the day sleeping or lying in bed, I'm not very tired now.    At least I don't ache so much.    It is no fun to be sick when it's hot out.   Even when your fever breaks, you feel hot and sweaty and it dosn't get better.   RwR is doing a lot better.  He actually made me lunch and dinner as I only had short bursts of energy through the day that always seemed to quickly turn into the need to lie down again.   Right now is the longest I've felt like being up in a while. If I can get some sleep tonight I might actually feel better tommorow.

I went to the Guelph Market with SandraRegina, since RwR is still suffering from the flu.   While it isn't as big as the Waterloo menonite market, the Guelph Market has a refreshingly local feel that the Waterloo Market has lost in the crush of tourists.    In Guelph you still feel like most of the vendors are real farmers or local people who make some craft or food item.    I managed to find all the stuff I needed, and SandraRegina found everything except grapes, but this time of year, you really need to import those.      But fruit is starting to arrive.   I didn't get any strawberries, cause I got some last night on the way home.     

Unfortunely going to the market also made me aware that I am not well myself.    Last night I felt worse (I felt cold when every one else was hot) but I didn't even have a fever.   RwR did.  Aparently going to work for on friday was a bad idea.    He's still sicker than me, but right now all my joints feel sore in an almost ichy way and it dosn't matter if I walk around or lie down, I still feel that way.   I think I might go and crawl into bed.    I get the feeling I won't be accomplishing much today.
